Ingredients.7: 1 freshly ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.10: 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves

Ingredients.17: 1  avocado - peeled, pitted, and thinly sliced

Directions.1: Bring chicken broth and quinoa to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until quinoa is tender and broth is absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes.

Directions.2: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Directions.3: Spread sweet potato and red onion onto a baking sheet. Drizzle 1 tablespoon olive oil over mixture and season with salt and pepper; toss to coat.

Directions.4: Bake in the preheated oven until sweet potatoes are tender, 20 to 25 minutes.

Directions.5: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir 2 cloves garlic and ginger until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add chicken and cook until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 6 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Cut chicken into 1-inch pieces.

Directions.6: Whisk 1 garlic clove, lime juice, peanut butter, soy sauce, and honey together in a bowl. Whisk 1 tablespoon olive oil and sesame oil into mixture until dressing is smooth.

Directions.7: Divide quinoa among bowls; top with chicken, sweet potato mixture, spinach, and avocado. Sprinkle cilantro and sesame seeds over the top and drizzle dressing over each bowl.
